intro: Hieracium fuscocinereum, commonly known as the brown-capped hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive brownish cap on the central disk, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
